page.title: 03Little Birchfield Farm.
page.content: Little Birchfield Farm belongs to Mr and Mrs Croft.It is a mixed arable farm with crops of wheat,barley and rapeseed.They also grow potatoes,sweed and peas.A machine called a Dresser cleans the crops.The rapeseed can be crushed which then lets out oil which can be made into margarine.Mr and Mrs Croft's farm covers 200 acres of land Mr and Mrs Croft have chickens,sheep, lamb and cattle.They have got 40 bullocks in the field which is away from the farm.The cattle are sold at 2 year old and are sold 40 at a time.Mr and Mrs Croft buy 400 turkeys just before Christmas for fattening.Sheep shearing is done by two men which go to Little Birchfield Farm.These men shear the sheep in the summer.The fleece from the sheep is sold for about four pound each.Mr Croft employs some men.He has one full time worker.
